p: Illicium oligandrum ( I. oligandrum) belongs to the family of Magnoliaceae, being a rich source of seco-prezizaane type sesquiterpenes [ 203]. It is known to have antiviral activity against herpes simplex virus type 2, coxsackie virus and influenza virus [ 204, 206]. It has some potent bioactive compounds, such as sesquiterpene lactones, neolignan glycosides, phenolic diglycosides and prenylated compounds which are responsible for its antiviral activities [ 204, 206]. However, this medicinal plant is also used for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, and neurotoxic and neuro-trophic effects [ 205]. Ma et al., 2013 reported the ethanolic extraction of spirooliganones A 1 & B from the roots of I. oligandrum and showed its potential to inhibit the activity of influenza virus (H3N2) (IC 50 3.70–33.33 µM) and coxsackie virus B3 [ 204].
